beer.beer_description: Dry & unparching, a super fruity pilsnah with a supple bitterness.

This beer is rather neat, we use a bunch of Canterbury wheat with some barley too. A luscious fruit salad of NZ hops makes for 100% local unfiltered deliciousness. Would you look at the time, it's quaff o'clock!

items.badge_description: Kiwis, rugby and sheep aren’t the only things New Zealand has to offer. There’s a ton of great beers in a variety of styles just waiting for you to explore! That's 445 different beers from a brewery in New Zealand.  Try 5 more for Level 90!

When a single isn’t enough, make it a double. Doubling the hops and malts in a recipe results in a higher ABV and can pack quite a boozey punch. That's 160 different beers with the style that contains Imperial / Double in its style name. Try 5 more for Level 33!

beer.beer_description: Brewed with a unique harmony of tradition and refined modern riffs. Brimming with chocolaty, nutty, and caramel notes. A malty biscuit body, resinous but not bitter.

items.checkin_comment: Pilsner tone with a pronounced alcohol after. Couldn’t drink too many of these in the sun.

beer.beer_description: To celebrate epic heavy metal band Shepherds Reign and their upcoming tour, we brewed and canned a limited edition Shepherds Reign South Auckland Lager, which will be launched at their Hallertau Riverhead gig on the 8th of March.

items.badge_description: Fresh from the tap is one of the best ways to enjoy a beer. Just try to use a glass and not drink directly from the tap, as tempting as it may be. That's 350 checkins with the serving style of Draft. Try 5 more for Level 71!

items.badge_description: Canning is all the rage and it's not hard to see why - travels well, more environmentally friendly, and no need to carry your bottle opener. That's 25 checkins with the serving style of Can. Try 5 more for Level 6! Want to learn more about this badge? Check out our podcast

beer.beer_description: To celebrate epic heavy metal band Shepherds Reign and their upcoming tour, we brewed and canned a limited edition Shepherds Reign South Auckland Lager, which will be launched at their Hallertau Riverhead gig on the 8th of March.

items.checkin_comment: The beer of Auckland? A little full of ourselves aren’t we for a 3.4 rated beer? Not bad though, crisp NZ style grassiness

We put the call out to the feijoa tree owning public of New Zealand and they came correct with the fruity goodness. The world's first feijoa crowd funded beer. A delicate aroma of ripe Feijoas on the nose. Fruity & tart on the tongue, with a fat & creamy mouthfeel from the inclusion of a bunch of oats and a little lactose.

items.badge_description: Happy Sour Beer Day! September 20th marks the refreshing beginning of Sour Beer Day 2025, ripe for celebration! No need to sugarcoat it, these tart treats aren’t for everyone, but that’s just fine with sour lovers like us. Let us berry the hatchet and squeeze the day! Follow @untappd and drop a comment with your favorite sour!

Everyone loves fresh beer, but obviously not as much as you do. You went straight to the source. 

That's a beer at 15 different venues categorized as a Brewery, Cidery or Meadery. Visit 5 more for Level 4!

items.checkin_comment: piney slightly bitter moreish IIPA. nice

items.badge_description: When a single isn’t enough, make it a double. Doubling the hops and malts in a recipe results in a higher ABV and can pack quite a boozey punch. That's 315 different beers with the style that contains Imperial / Double in its style name. Try 5 more for Level 64!

beer.beer_description: One of the originators in the NZ craft beer scene. The sour side of life. This beer spends two years in Chardonnay barrels partying with the nicest bugs we know. Lean and fruity, peachy and very dry. Delicate, racy and moreish.

user.bio: Too many good beers out there to drink the same beer all the time.

beer.beer_description:
Yowza! This character’s outspoken.
Bursting with opinions. Arrives with
a floral bouquet. Hoots. Honks. Hops.
Charismatic. Honey. Bombastic.
Citrus. Distinguished. Tang. Then
closes the deal guaranteeing your
thirst thoroughly quenched.
The fiercely floral and fragrant hop, known as the Earth Wolf by the Ancients, has been cunningly tamed with a soft, rich maltiness. Please drink respectfully

Hot summer days and steamy nights beg this Low Carb Lager into New Zealand life, to sparkle in our sunlight. Tropical fruits and luscious blueberries will saunter up your nose at first. Then in slinks the soft rounded palate and crisp delicate dryness, to satisfy your thirst.
I see red, I see red, I see Red Lager! Italian like a balcony in Verona. Luigi knows its a beer for the twilight, satiated and refreshed, earner of a knowing smile.

Historically from Germany, this Schwarzbier (or Black Beer) is a real act of balance. On the one hand the chocolate aromas are sweet, yet they’re also a bit bitter with a sniff of roasted coffee and a sneaky spicy noble hop. The colour is dark yet ruby red under the light. The roasted malts surprise with their smoothness in your mouth and the bittersweet chocolate is right there until it dries out slowly at the end. In the equilibrium, this dark beer is deceptively light.

The Stuntman is all about pushing boundaries and testing limits of human endurance. This is a very hoppy beer! Some might say too hoppy, but you “hop heads” out there are in for a real treat. Ten hop additions create a tsunami of flavours and textures that explode across the poor unsuspecting palette. Taste buds are left reeling, stunned, like they have been eleven rounds with “The Green Machine”. If you find all the hops a bit much, remember, It’s not to hoppy, you’re to soft!! HARDEN UP. The Stuntman is stupid beer for brave people………….so get brave stupid!
Double the hops, half the tipsy. The preferred beer of band practices. Ensures the rhythm section stays in time.
Soured Imperial Indian Pale Ale
Hallertau Double Stout 8.8% A seriously black stout dominated by intense roasted flavours with solid hop bitterness and warming alcohol on the finish.
Dry & unparching, a super fruity pilsnah with a supple bitterness.
A big fat IPA with juicy caramel and biscuit flavours combining with Jammy berry hop characters with a cleansing bitter finish.

The Porter Noir is a beer from way out of left field. A 6.6% Porter was aged for four months in Pinot Noir Wine Barrels acquired from local winery Kumeu River. The barrels were only gently hot water rinsed before use to retain the wine charter and also the native yeasts in the wood. The four month maturation in the barrel develops the palette with gentile woody tannins and fruits of the forest from the previous resident. Combined with the remnants of chocolate and soft acidity from the native yeasts creates amazing mouth feel with a long drying finish. The secondary fermentation in the bottle was carried out with the native yeasts from the barrel, namely brettanomyces. This is the same yeast used to bottle condition the famous Belgian Trappist beer Orval. The brettanomyces character dominates the aroma. Layers of complexity, red currents, earthy gumboots, a stroll through the barnyard?? All very interesting stuff. The beer has been conditioned in 750 ml Champaign bottles for 6 months prior to release and with correct cellaring will continue to improve for up to 3 years. The Porter Noir is a strictly limited release and is only available from Hallertau Brewbar & Restaurant.
Pale yellow in colour, soft hop nose with a rounded firm malty character. Moderate bitterness with a trademark dry finish.

When life gives you lemons.... Our latest Kettle Sour is made with fruit from our neighbours the multi-generational Boric family orchard. A gentle lactic kettle sour combined with heritage lemons combines to create a delicious confection of a beer. Layers of lemon, vanilla, cream and a big zesty finish leaves you wanting more.
Crunch. Clean. Crisp. Refreshing. Bite. Blue skies. Cut Grass. Good times. Granny Smith would be rap’t with this sublimely satisfying cider.

beer.beer_name: Thomson Whisky Barrel Aged Double Stout

beer.beer_description:
Fresh zesty Grapefruit rind and piles of Pine needles. Super oily orange skin and subtle caramel flavours. Finishing with a lingering resinous bitterness.

A flash back to 2009, the original Maximus IPA recipe before the good American hops ran out.  Loads of mid boil hops for huge hop flavour and excessive bitterness. Then dry hops to within an inch of your life.  A tribute to the good old days when IPAs were proper bitter.
A sour belgian

A Belgian-style wheat beer spiced with tangelos from our neighbour's Boric Orchard. Crazy fruity esters of banana courtesy of the yeast and aroma of delicious tangelos, light soft body with a tart finish. This is the latest in a series of Hallertau seasonal releases using Boric fruit as an adjunct for delicious beer.

A very large aromatic citrus and hop aroma, very lean on the malt with layers of hoppy tanginess. A gentle clean bitterness accentuated by the grapefruit addition with just a hint of warming booze at the end.
A very large aromatic hop aroma, very lean on the malt with, layers of hoppy tanginess. A gentle clean bitterness.
US hopped
Aromas of fresh silage and almost dried up creek bed. Pungent lemons and decomposing apricot stones lingering in the finish.
